abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Energy
            Efficiency Program and Industrial Sector Project is to
            overcome barriers to the development of a sustainable market
            for energy efficiency products. The closing date for the
            project will be extended from December 31, 2010 until
            September 30, 2011. This will be the second extension. The
            original closing date was December 31, 2009, and a first one
            year extension was granted in July 2009. The Grant was
            approved on November 4, 2004, and became effective on
            December 13, 2004. Its amount is USD 8.5 million. As
            disbursement was very slow for the first years of
            implementation of the project, the Tunisian government
            requested an extension in May 2009. It was granted by the
            World Bank on July 23, 2009, while an action plan was being
            developed to accelerate disbursement. A reallocation of
            funds also took place in July 2010, totaling USD 625,000
            (USD 500,000 as per unallocated funds in the Grant
            Agreement, USD 125,000 from Sotugar fees, which were
            overestimated in the initial allocation). USD 225,000 were
            reallocated to the guarantee and USD 400,000 to the TA,
            leading to the current budgets of USD 3.725 million and USD
            2 million, respectively.
